refnamediv.refpurpose: a spreadsheet-like matrix widget for GTK applications

tgroup.tbody:
"active-cell" Read A tuple (row, column) indicating the active cell (the cell being edited)
"autoresize" Read-Write If True, the cells will be resized automatically when text is being introduced by the user
"autoscroll" Read-Write If True, the sheet will be automatically scrolled the last row/column in the sheet is reached
"clip-text" Read-Write If True, the cell text will be clipped
"column-titles-visible" Read-Write If True, the column titles will be visible
"columns-resizable" Read-Write If True, columns can be resized by the user
"gird-visible" Read-Write If True, the grid lines will be visible
"locked" Read-Write If True, the user modification of the contents of each cell is prevented
"n-columns" Read The number of columns in the sheet.
"n-rows" Read The number of rows in the sheet.
"row-titles-visible" Read-Write If True, the row titles will be visible
"rows-resizable" Read-Write If True, rows can be resized by the user >
"selected-range" Read A gtksheet.SheetRange indicating the cells in the sheet that are currently selected
"selection-mode" Read-Write
The selection mode of the sheet. It can have two values: gtk.SELECTION_SINGLE, indicating that no cell can be selected, or gtk.SELECTION_BROWSE, indicating that multiple cells can be selected.
"state" Read The selection state of the sheet. Its possible values are, see the get_state() method for its possible values.
"title" Read-Write The title of the sheet.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: gtksheet.Sheet is a matrix widget which can be used to build spreadsheet-like interfaces.

listitem.simpara: if True, a browser sheet is created. In a browser sheet, cells cannot be edited(read-only).

A GTK type derived from gtk.Entry to use as the widget for editing cells. For example, you can use a gtk.SpinButton instead of the default gtksheet.ItemEntry. Note that if the browser parameter is True, the entry_type argument is ignored.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_hadjustment
refsect2.para: The set_hadjustment() method can be used to change the gtk.Adjustment object used for horizontal scrolling.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_vadjustment
refsect2.para: The set_vadjustment() method can be used to change the gtk.Adjustment object used for vertical scrolling.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.change_entry

listitem.simpara: A GTK type derived from gtk.Entry (gtk.SpinButton, gtk.Entry...)

refsect2.para: The change_entry() method can be used to change the widget type used to edit the cells content. It must be a type derived from gtk.Entry such as gtk.ItemEntry (the default), gtk.Entry itself or gtk.SpinButton.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_entry
refsect2.para: Returns the current sheet's entry widget, the widget used to edit sheet cells.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_entry_widget
refsect2.para: Returns the current sheet's entry widget, the widget used to edit sheet cells.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_state
refsect2.para: Returns the state of the sheet, which can be:

listitem.simpara: A range of cells is selected

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_columns_count
refsect2.para: Get the number of the columns of the sheet.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_rows_count
refsect2.para: Get the number of the rows of the sheet.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_visible_range
refsect2.para: Returns the range of cells that are currently visible (i.e. displayed) to the user.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_selection_mode
refsect2.para: Sets the selection mode of the cell. The selection mode can be either gtk.SELECTION_SINGLE, indicating that no cell can be selected, or gtk.SELECTION_BROWSE, indicating that multiple cells can be selected.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_autoresize
refsect2.para: Sets whether the cells will be autoresized when text is typed.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.autoresize
refsect2.para: Gets the autoresize mode of the sheet.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_autoscroll
refsect2.para: Sets whether the table will be automatically scrolled when the last row or column in the sheet is reached.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.autoscroll
refsect2.para: Gets the autoscroll mode of the sheet.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_clip_text
refsect2.para: Sets whether the text in the cell will be clipped.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.clip_text
refsect2.para: Gets the clip text mode of the sheet.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_justify_entry
refsect2.para: Sets whether the text in the cell will be justified.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.justify_entry
refsect2.para: Gets the justification status in the sheet.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_locked
refsect2.para: The locked() method set the "locked" property to the value of locked. If locked is True, the sheet will be locked, preventing user modification of the cells.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.locked

listitem.simpara: the current value of the "locked" property

refsect2.para: The locked() method returns the current value of the "locked" property.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_title

listitem.simpara: a string to be set as the sheet title

refsect2.para: The set_title() method sets the text to be used as the sheet's title.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.freeze
refsect2.para: The freeze() method freezes all visual updates of the sheet. Changes in cells' contents will occur in a more efficient way than on a unfrozen sheet.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.thaw
refsect2.para: The thaw() method reverts the sheet to an unfrozen mode, with all visual updates taking place normally.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_background

listitem.simpara: the gtk.gdk.Color to be used as default background color

refsect2.para: The set_background() method sets the default background color used to render the cells.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_grid

listitem.simpara: the gtk.gdk.Color to draw sheet grid lines

refsect2.para: The set_grid() method sets the color of the grid lines of the sheet.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.show_grid

listitem.simpara: if True, the grid lines will be shown

refsect2.para: The show_grid() method method sets the "grid-visible" property to the value indicated by show. If show is True the grid lines of the sheet are visible.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.grid_visible

listitem.simpara: the current value of the "grid-visible" property

refsect2.para: The grid_visible() method returns the current value of the "grid-visible" property.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_column_title

listitem.simpara: the column whose title will be set
a string to be used as the title of the column

refsect2.para: The set_column_title() method sets the title of the column indicated by column to the value of title.

Note that the title of a column is not displayed, it is an internal string. To set the label that will be displayed, use the
column_button_add_label() method.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_column_title

listitem.simpara: the column whose title will be retuned
the current title of column indicated by column

refsect2.para: The get_column_title() method returns the current title of the column indicated by column.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_row_title

listitem.simpara: the row whose title will be set
a string to be used as the title of the row

refsect2.para: The set_row_title() method sets the title of the row indicated by row to the value of title.

Note that the title of a row is not displayed, it is an internal string. To set the label that will be displayed, use the
row_button_add_label() method.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_row_title

listitem.simpara: the row whose title will be retuned
the current title of row indicated by row

refsect2.para: The get_row_title() method returns the current title of the row indicated by row.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.row_button_add_label

listitem.simpara: the row whose button label will be set
a string to be used as the label of the row button

refsect2.para: The row_button_add_label() method sets the label displayed by the button of the row indicated by row.
If no label is added to a row button, the row number will be displayed.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.column_button_add_label

listitem.simpara: the column whose button label will be set
a string to be used as the label of the column button

refsect2.para: The column_button_add_label() method sets the label displayed by the button of the column indicated by column.
If no label is added to a column button, the row number will be displayed.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.row_button_get_label

listitem.simpara: the row whose button label will be returned
the label of the row button or None if no label was set for this row

refsect2.para: The row_button_get_label() method returns the label added to the button of the row indicated by row. If no label was added to a row button, None is returned.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.column_button_add_label

listitem.simpara: the column whose button label will be returned
the label of the column button or None if no label was set for this column

refsect2.para: The column_button_add_label() method returns the label added to the button of the column indicated by column. If no label was added to a column button, None is returned.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.row_button_justify
refsect2.para: The row_button_justify() method sets the justification type used for the label of the button of the row indicated by row. Possible values for justification are gtk.JUSTIFY_LEFT, gtk.JUSTIFY_RIGHT and gtk.JUSTIFY_CENTER.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.column_button_justify
refsect2.para: The column_button_justify() method sets the justification type used for the label of the button of the column indicated by column. Possible values for justification are gtk.JUSTIFY_LEFT, gtk.JUSTIFY_RIGHT and gtk.JUSTIFY_CENTER.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.moveto
refsect2.para: The moveto() method scrolls the viewing area of the sheet to the given column and row.
row_align and col_align are values between 0.0-1.0 that represent the location where the row should appear on the screnn, 0.0 being top or left, 1.0 being bottom or right.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_row_titles_width

listitem.simpara: the new width, in pixels, of the row titles

refsect2.para: The set_row_titles_width() method sets the width of the row titles (the row buttons), to the value of width.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_column_titles_height

listitem.simpara: the new height, in pixels, of the column titles

refsect2.para: The set_column_titles_height() method sets the height of the column titles (the column buttons), to the value of height.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.show_row_titles
refsect2.para: The show_row_titles() causes the the row titles (the row buttons) to be displayed.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.show_column_titles
refsect2.para: The show_column_titles() causes the the column titles (the column buttons) to be dispalyed.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.hide_row_titles
refsect2.para: The hide_row_titles() causes the the row titles (the row buttons) to be hidden.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.hide_column_titles
refsect2.para: The hide_column_titles() makes the the column titles (the column buttons) to be hidden.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.row_titles_visible
refsect2.para: The row_titles_visible() returns the value of the "row-titles-visible" property. If "row-titles-visible" is True, the row buttons are displayed.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.hide_column_titles_visible
refsect2.para: The column_titles_visible() returns the value of the "row-titles-visible" property. If "column-titles-visible" is True, the column buttons are displayed.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.row_set_sensitivity

listitem.simpara: if True make the row sensitive

refsect2.para: The row_set_sensitivity() method makes the row indicated by row sensitive or insensitive according to the value of sensitive. The row button of an insensitive row will appear "grayed out" and the user won't be able to interact with it, though the cells of the row will still be editable.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.rows_set_sensitivity

listitem.simpara: if True make all the rows sensitive

refsect2.para: The rows_set_sensitivity() method makes all the rows in the sheet sensitive or insensitive according to the value of sensitive. The row button of an insensitive row will appear "grayed out" and the user won't be able to interact with it, though the cells of the row will still be editable.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.column_set_sensitivity

listitem.simpara: if True make the column sensitive

refsect2.para: The column_set_sensitivity() method makes the column indicated by column sensitive or insensitive according to the value of sensitive. The column button of an insensitive column will appear "grayed out" and the user won't be able to interact with it, though the cells of the column will still be editable.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.columns_set_sensitivity

listitem.simpara: if True make all the columns sensitive

refsect2.para: The columns_set_sensitivity() method makes all the columns in the sheet sensitive or insensitive according to the value of sensitive. The column button of an insensitive column will appear "grayed out" and the user won't be able to interact with it, though the cells of the column will still be editable.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.rows_set_resizable

listitem.simpara: if True make all the rows resizable

refsect2.para: The rows_set_resizable() method sets the "rows-resizable" property to the value of resizable. If resizable is True the rows can be resized by the user.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.columns_set_resizable

listitem.simpara: if True make all the columns resizable

refsect2.para: The columns_set_resizable() method sets the "columns-resizable" property to the value of resizable. If resizable is True the columns can be resized by the user.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.rows_resizable
refsect2.para: The rows_resizable() method returns the value of the "rows-resizable" property. If "rows-resizable" is True the rows can be resized by the user.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.columns_resizable
refsect2.para: The columns_resizable() method returns the value of the "columns-resizable" property. If "columns-resizable" is True the columns can be resized by the user.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.row_set_visibility

listitem.simpara: if True make the row visible

refsect2.para: The row_set_visibility() method makes the row indicated by row visible or invisible according to the value of visible.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.row_label_set_visibility

listitem.simpara: if True make the row label visible

refsect2.para: The row_label_set_visibility() method makes the label of the row indicated by row visible or invisible according to the value of visible.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.rows_labels_set_visibility

listitem.simpara: if True makes all the rows labels visible

refsect2.para: The rows_labels_set_visibility() method makes the labels of all the rows visible or invisible according to the value of visible.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.column_set_visibility

listitem.simpara: if True make the column visible

refsect2.para: The column_set_visibility() method makes the column indicated by column visible or invisible according to the value of visible.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.column_label_set_visibility

listitem.simpara: if True make the column label visible

refsect2.para: The column_label_set_visibility() method makes the label of the column indicated by column visible or invisible according to the value of visible.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.columns_labels_set_visibility

listitem.simpara: if True makes all the columns labels visible

refsect2.para: The columns_labels_set_visibility() method makes the labels of all the columns visible or invisible according to the value of visible.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.select_row
refsect2.para: The select_row() method selects the row indicated by row. When a row is selected all the cells in it will be highlighted and the "selected-range" property is set accordingly.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.select_column
refsect2.para: The select_column() method selects the column indicated by column. When a column is selected all the cells in it will be highlighted and the "selected-range" property is set accordingly.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.clip_range
refsect2.para: The clip_range() method draws a dashed line around the block of cells indicated by range to indicate that the cell contents are copied to the clipboard. Only one range of cells can be clipped at a time.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.unclip_range
refsect2.para: The unclip_range() method reverses the effects of the clip_range() method, removing the dashed line, indicating that the cell contents are no longer in the clipboard.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.in_clip

listitem.simpara: True if a range of cells has been clipped

refsect2.para: The in_clip() method returns True if a range of cells has been clipped with the clip_range() method.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_hadjustment
refsect2.para: The get_hadjustment() method returns the gtk.Adjustment object used for horizontal scrolling.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_vadjustment
refsect2.para: The get_vadjustment() returns the gtk.Adjustment object used for vertical scrolling.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.select_range

listitem.simpara: a gtksheet.SheetRange indicating the range of cells to be selected

refsect2.para: The select_range() method selects the block of cells indicated by range. This block of cells is highlighted and the "selected-range" property is set accordingly.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.unselect_range
refsect2.para: The unselect_range() method unselects any cells currently selected (indicated by the "selected-range" property, and sets the value of this property is accordingly.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_active_cell

listitem.simpara: True if the well was activated successfully

refsect2.para: The set_active_cell() method sets the value of the "active-cell" property to the values indicated by row and column. The active cell is the cell currently being edited by the user and where the entry widget is displayed.
If the current active cell can't be deactivated or if the indicated cell can't be activated False is returned.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_active_cell
refsect2.para: The get_active_cell() method returns the value of the "active-cell" property. The active cell is the cell currently being edited by the user and where the entry widget is displayed.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_cell

listitem.simpara: the justification to use to display the cell text
a string with the text to be displayed on the cell

refsect2.para: The set_cell() method sets contents and the justification mode of the cell indicated by row and column to the values of text and justification. Possible values for justification are gtk.JUSTIFY_LEFT, gtk.JUSTIFY_RIGHT and gtk.JUSTIFY_CENTER.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.set_cell_text

listitem.simpara: a string with the text to be displayed on the cell

refsect2.para: The set_cell_text() method sets contents of the cell indicated by row and column to text.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.cell_get_text

listitem.simpara: a string with the contents of the cell

refsect2.para: The cell_get_text() method returns the contents of the cell indicated by row and column.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.cell_clear
refsect2.para: The cell_clear() method clears the contents of the cell indicated by row and column.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.cell_delete
refsect2.para: The cell_delete() method clears the contents of the cell indicated by row and column and remove any links present in the cel.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.range_clear

listitem.simpara: a gtksheet.SheetRange indicating the range of cells to be cleared or None to clear all the cells in the sheet

refsect2.para: The range_clear() method clears the contents of the cells indicated by range. If range is None all the cells in the sheet will be cleared.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.range_delete

listitem.simpara: a gtksheet.SheetRange indicating the range of cells to be cleared or None to clear all the cells in the sheet

refsect2.para: The range_delete() method clears the contents of the cells indicated by range and removes any links in them. If range is None all the cells in the sheet will be deleted.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.cell_get_state

listitem.simpara: the cell state, which can be gtk.STATE_NORMAL or gtk.STATE_SELECTED

refsect2.para: The cell_get_state() method returns the state of the cell which can be either gtk.STATE_SELECTED if the cell is currently selected or gtk.STATE_NORMAL if it is not selected.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_pixel_finfo

listitem.simpara: a tuple with the row and column numbers correspoding to the cell located in the pixel position indicated by x and y or None if no cell is located in that pixel position

refsect2.para: The get_pixel_position() method returns the row and column numbers correspoding to the cell located in the pixel position indicated by x and y. If no cell is located in that pixel position, None is returned.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.Sheet.get_cell_area

listitem.simpara: a gtk.gdk.Rectangle with the area of the cell (the pixel position of the top-left corner and the cell width and height) or None if the cell area cannot be retrieved.

refsect2.para: The get_cell_area() method returns the area of the cell as a gtk.gdk.Rectangle containing the pixel position of the top-left corner of the cell (the "x" and "y" attributes of the gtk.gdk.Rectangle) and the cell width and height (the "width" and "height" attributes of the gtk.gdk.Rectangle).
If the cell area can not be retrieve (i.e the row and column numbers provided are wrong), None is returned.

refsect2.title: gtksheet.gtk_sheet_check_version

listitem.simpara: None if all the version numbers match the gtksheet library version numbers, else it returns a string with a descriptive error message.

refsect2.para: The gtksheet_check_version() function checks that the indicated version numbers match the gtksheet library version and returns a descriptive error message if these numbers do not match.

refsect2.title: The "activate" gtksheet.Sheet Signal

listitem.simpara: the sheet that received the signal
the row number of the activated cell
the column number of the activated cell
additional data (if any) specified with the connect() method

refsect2.para: The "activate" signal is emitted whenever a cell is activated, either programatically or by the user when clicking on it.

refsect2.title: The "changed" gtksheet.Sheet Signal

listitem.simpara: the sheet that received the signal
the row number of the changed cell
the column number of the changed cell
additional data (if any) specified with the connect() method

refsect2.para: The "changed" signal is emitted when typing into the active cell, changing its content. It is emitted after each key press in cell and after deactivating cell..
